name: Westin Oaks Houston at the Galleria

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While I agree that the renovations make some aspects of the hotel less appealing, overall we had a very decent stay at the Westin Oaks. We stayed on the 16th floor and our room was quite, clean, everything worked and the hotel served its purpose.
reviews.title: Decent Stay

reviews.text: I do not believe this hotel should be rated at 4 stars. I have stayed in several other Westin hotels(Downtown Houston, Georgetown D.C) and they were nicer in my opinion. The age/state of the elevator, room and bathroom left a little to be desired. The floor of the tub appeared stained with age, and there wasn't nearly enough light in the bathroom. The windows and balcony were old the room was sparsley decorated.
reviews.title: Location, location, location

reviews.text: Until they get everything renovated and up to date, the Westin Oaks really needs to lower their star rating and price because the guests are being shortchanged. Thank goodness I got a very good priceline rate ($55/night) because this hotel was not worth the regular price.
reviews.title: A hotel to avoid... continued poor quality of Gallera Westins

reviews.text: Ok, the hotel is under a huge renovation and yes, the lobby is a mess, elevators are not in the level of the floor ( be careful!), noisy etc etc BUT once you are in your room it wasn´t that bad ....
reviews.title: I probably wouldn't stay here voluntarily

reviews.text: I stayed three nighst with my two best friends on a shopping trip. The beds are really comfortables, the room was clean, had a cofee maker (great way to start the day!) and the noises began at 8:30/9 am just when we were going out to have breaksfast and go shopping.
reviews.title: Now Cringe When I Win this on Priceline

reviews.text: Stayed for business feb 28 - mar 2nd. I checked reviews before I stayed and was nervous. I did see that the hotel was still under construction with one elevator out to be updated. I was on the spg floor and the rooms were large, clean, and had a nice balcony (floor 18, room 1824). My co worker did not have a newer room. Overall I would stay here again. Location was great, restaurants all around, and free parking under the hotel.
reviews.title: Not as bad as the reviews - SPG member

reviews.text: I am cutrrently staying here and have 3 days left. My first room didn't have hot water so I was relocated. My second room still does not have hot water and the 13.99 movie I ordered quiet in the middle. I was told it would reset and start again, but it never did. The resteraunt they list as their own is a part of the Galliria. Don't go in your Comfie clothes! This hotel is Not worth the money.
reviews.title: Not worth the stay!

reviews.text: Workout facility is in an awkward location.
reviews.title: Excellent facility, staff and room.

reviews.text: No restaurant was available. Granted, being in the Mall offers many opportunities, however often business travelers are tired and may not want to leave for a meal.
reviews.title: Great

reviews.text: All the new renovations are spot on. And the staff is great. The front Desk Staff and front Desk manager Simon are in the Top 5 of hotel services in my book. And I stay at a lot of hotels. Keep up the Good Work. You'll feel like a friend at the Westin Oaks Hotel Houston.
reviews.title: I HATE Malls, BUT...

reviews.text: The Westin Oaks Galleria is perfect for those who want to shop or leave their wives to shop while tending other business. The hotel is literally connected to the mall. Saturday parking is a nightmare. If you arrive on Saturday, plan on looking very long and hard for free parking close to the hotel. I became frustrated after an hour of looking for free parking and ended up paying $24 for valet parking.
reviews.title: Best location for Galleria Shopping.

reviews.text: All the staff we encountered were very friendly and eager to help. The hotel had 5 star service with a 3 star price. We stayed in room 1623 which faces the busy and sometimes loud Westheimer road. The room was fairly large, and very clean but needed a fresh coat of paint.
reviews.title: Talk about nickle and diming...

reviews.text: Overall we enjoyed our stay and will return. However, next time I will request a room facing away from Westheimer road.
reviews.title: Shame on Westin
We were impressed!
reviews.text: The hotel is fine - but they will try to take every dime you have. I understand the usual charges for the phone and business center expenses, but this was beyond that. Even the in-room coffee was charged! Normally if a hotel gives you a mini-coffee machine, the one pot coffee grounds are complementary, here it is a minibar charge.

reviews.title: Expected better for the cost
reviews.text: There is no gym located in the hotel. To use a gym, you have to go into the mall and walk across to the Westin Gallaria (partner hotel). It is not a long walk, but since the hotel does not offer any lockers, you have to walk through the mall to the gym in your work-out clothes.

I like staying at the Westin Oaks and Westin Galleria when I go on shopping weekends to Houston. The location cannot be beat. Take the elevator to the mall. Rooms are nice and comfortable. I spent the Mexican holiday weekend of December 10-12 here and it seemed like so did the rest of Mexico.
reviews.title: Great location for shopping, nice rooms, service non-existent

reviews.text: Service does not exist. Front Desk is a disorganized mess. Bellmen disappear forever and this trip I saw three of them delivering a blanket - no wonder why they are never in the lobby.
reviews.title: Nothing Heavenly about it...
Relaxing weekend
reviews.text: Rooms are comfortable, but not very clean. I was not bothered much by the smell of cigarette smoke in my room (520) or the butts on the tiny terrace. However, my first morning, I sat in the comfortable chair to read the paper and drink the in-room Starbuck's coffee and found that the smell came from a dirty ashtray on the table next to the chair. I had not noticed it, even when I opened the terrace door to air out the room. (I also kicked the butts off the terrace and as this room was right above the main hotel entry, did not do much to improve image.)

reviews.title: Beautiful Elegant Hotel--A Must Stay Place
reviews.text: WATCH YOUR ROOM BILL CHARGES. I had US$27 for parking even though I had no car and US$30.12 for one Sprite I drank from the mini bar. There is no hassle when you point out such issues, the staff takes off the charges right away. It must be common at this factory hotel with minimal service to mischarge guests and thus, there is no arguing needed.

reviews.title: Can't miss with these Great Rooms!
reviews.text: Would I stay here again? Yes, the location is great, rooms not bad and for a weekend of shopping, I really do not need the hotel staff. Do I think the hotel can improve? Absolutely, but they clearly do not care, this is a cash cow.
Starwood and Westin have built a great brand that is widely recognized in my high-travel industry; this hotel does an extreme disservice by diluting that brand.
reviews.title: Not Really a Westin

reviews.text: The Good - the hotel is attached to the Galleria mall which makes shopping easy and a plethora of eating choices; the sports bar, while not fancy, had a really good salad
reviews.title: Over time maybe...progress doesn't happen over night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Bad - the building is old, and while apparently being remodeled, the remodel is obviously very skimpy; why wouldn't you replace chipped wood, dinged doors, dirty/backed-up tubs, noisy A/Cs and popcorn ceilings if you are going to go through the remodelling effort?
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: 1) No one working the Preferred/Platinum desk at checkin (had to ask and ended up taking longer than if I had stood in the regular checkin line)
reviews.title: Excellent stay at the Westin Oaks!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my wife while visiting friends.Room and bed were very comfortable and in great shape.The Hotel is connected to tthe largest mall I have ever seen.My wife shopped like crazy and there were plenty of restaurants also.Only drawback was that the room rate seemed high. Staff was helpful with directions for places outside the hotel and there was allot to do in the area.
reviews.title: Shopping and more

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at this hotel over a weekend. When we arrived on Friday night, there was only one person at the check-in desk for multiple families trying to check-in, so the wait was way too long. The hallway leading to our room was dark, dingy and smelled bad. Our first room was unacceptable due to 3 burned out lightbulbs (although the room was still way too dark even after those lightbulbs were replaced), stains on the carpet, leaky faucets and an unpleasant smell. Our "balcony" was simply a dark, concrete alley with puddles of water everywhere, which we shared with many other guests. The next room also had burned out lightbulbs, leaky faucets, a smell and a dirty carpet. Finally, we decided we wanted to check out the Westin Galleria (sister hotel w/in Galleria). The room change was easy and the Westin Galleria was SLIGHTLY nicer. It had less of a smell and seemed like it was a bit newer, but still not what you would expect for a "4 star" hotel. Bottom line-the Westin Oaks and Westin Galleria are not worth it! They seriously need to be cleaned and renovated. Better management is also necessary. Obviously, Westin thinks it can get away with not keeping up these 2 hotels because of their location. I know it is convenient to stay in the Galleria but there are tons of hotels right across the street that are just as convenient and actually nice!!! Try the JW Marriott, I really liked my stay there and it is only a minute walk across the street to the Galleria.
reviews.title: Old and run-down!

reviews.text: loved this place .The staff was very helpful with area Mexican restaurants and clubs.The shopping is phenomenol.
reviews.title: Galleria Rocks

reviews.text: Will be back !
reviews.title: two terrible stays

reviews.text: The first time I stayed at this hotel, I didn't have hot water, they didn't deliver a bill or a newspaper in the morning, the fan in the room was so loud that it woke me up each time if kicked in. Lastly, I was put on such a low floor that I heard the garbage trucks at 3am. So, the manager apologized and asked me to give them another chance. Stupidly, I did.
reviews.title: Shame on Westin II

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, perfect location, fabulous beds and pillows!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: I too am sitting here in my room writing a review of this property. Everything on the prior reviews are accurate. Another non-mentioned issue is the parking. We drove around for over 1/2 hour and couldn't find a place. Need handicapped, well there are none. Normal parking would have been fine but none of those either. Had to park valet and pay for less than an hour stay. I love Westin properties, but oh my, what a disappointment. I could write all night but I won't
reviews.title: What a Disappoinment

reviews.text: I usually know what to expect from a Westin - a comfortable stay with minimal frills. But this Westin disappointed even that expectation. I was on the SPG guest floor and my door doesn't close behind me by itself. Needless to say, I didn't discover this until after a few hours of being in the room.
reviews.title: Disappointed in this Westin

reviews.text: Other things I found really careless - there are no bathrobes in the rooms. The hairdryer is tucked away on a high shelf in the closet. There's no mini bar available. There's no turn down service. The valet service rarely answers its phone.
reviews.title: STAY AWAY, NOT KIDDING

reviews.text: I just expected more when I'm paying upwards of $200 a night for a room.
reviews.title: NO hot water

reviews.text: Staying at the Galleria was very convenient for the conference I was attending at the Westin, and the staff at the Oaks, for the most part, was very cordial and accommodating. My first room was extremely large and clean although somewhat worn, but the air conditioning never worked properly. I called the
reviews.title: Westin Oaks AC Needs TLC
